https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: A single message sent to a recipient.
The campaign activity originating a message to a recipient.

xdm:id.title: Delivery ID
xdm:id.description: The campaign activity originating this message.

xdm:from.title: From
xdm:from.description:
Address used as a from/sender/caller address. Depending on the communication channel, the `address` has a different format.

  * `email`: an email address.
  * `textMessage` or `phone`: a shortcode or phone number.

xdm:testEnabled.title: Test Enabled
xdm:testEnabled.description: Specify whether campaign activity is of type A/B testing.

xdm:messageClass.title: Message Class
xdm:messageClass.description: Mode of delivery for the messages sent.

xdm:templateName.title: Delivery Template's Internal Name
xdm:templateName.description: A human-friendly identifier of the the parent entity (in case of event_based or continuous message Class) of the campaign activity originating this message.

xdm:templateID.title: Identifier of the Template
xdm:templateID.description:
The delivery template's ID used to initialize this delivery.

The type the template used in Adobe Campaign can be identified using the `messageClass`.

* `messageClass` = `oneTime`: the template is standard delivery template.
* `messageClass` = `continuous`: the template is a recurring delivery.
* `messageClass` = `transactional`: the template is a transactional message template.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Mutated Fields from Previous ExperienceEvent.
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Information of the fields that have changed since the previous ExperienceEvent to keep track of the state changes across events. For e.g. if when an email gets sent, an ExperienceEvent with metric `sends` will be sent. This may get bounced and an ExperienceEvent with metric `bounces` will be sent then. It may be important for a downstream application to know that the previous ExperienceEvent with metric `sends` is now to be invalidated. This field will contain the values from the previous ExperienceEvent that have a different value in the current ExperienceEvent.
